Package ohos.accessibility

Class AccessibilitySystemAbilityClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.accessibility.AccessibilitySystemAbilityClient

  • public class AccessibilitySystemAbilityClient
extends Object
    Provides a client for interacting with the accessibility ability.

    The client provides functions such as sending accessibility events specified by AccessibilityEventInfo to the accessibility ability, querying the accessibility status, and sending accessibility status change notifications.

    For example, when a view control gains the focus, this class will send an AccessibilityEventInfo#TYPE_VIEW_FOCUSED_EVENT event to notify the accessibility ability.

    Since:
    1
    See Also:
    AccessibilityEventInfo, AccessibilityStateObserver, AccessibilityAbilityInfo
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Accessibility#ABILITY

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static AccessibilitySystemAbilityClient getInstance​(Context abilityContext)
        Obtains the AccessibilitySystemAbilityClient instance.
        Parameters:
        abilityContext - Indicates the context of the associated ability.
        Returns:
        Returns the client instance.

      • sendEvent

        public boolean sendEvent​(int eventType,
                         int viewId)
        Sends an accessibility event.

        This method is used to send an accessibility event to the accessibility ability.

        For example, when a view control gains the focus, this method will send an AccessibilityEventInfo#TYPE_VIEW_FOCUSED_EVENT event to notify the accessibility ability.

        Parameters:
        eventType - Identifies the accessibility event specified by AccessibilityEventInfo.
        viewId - Indicates the ID of the view to be associated with the event.
        Returns:
        Returns True if the event is successfully sent; returns False otherwise, for example, the event ID is invalid or the accessibility ability is disabled.

      • sendEvent

        public boolean sendEvent​(AccessibilityEventInfo eventInfo)
        Sends information about an accessibility event.

        This method is used to send information about an accessibility event to the accessibility ability.

        For example, when a view control gains the focus, your app can use this method to send information about an AccessibilityEventInfo#TYPE_VIEW_FOCUSED_EVENT event to notify the accessibility ability, such as the action triggering this event, package name of the target application, associated view ID, and event record list.

        Parameters:
        eventInfo - Indicates the accessibility event information specified by AccessibilityEventInfo.
        Returns:
        Returns True if the event information is successfully sent; returns False if the event information fails to be sent for reasons such as the event ID is invalid or the accessibility ability is disabled.
        Since:
        2

      • getAbilityList

        public List<AccessibilityAbilityInfo> getAbilityList​(int accessibilityAbilityTypes,
                                                     int stateType)
        Queries the list of accessibility abilities.

        This method is used to query information about specified accessibility abilities with the given search criteria. For example, you can use this method to check whether an ability is enabled and send a notification to the application if no match is found.

        Parameters:
        accessibilityAbilityTypes - Indicates the accessibility type specified by AccessibilityAbilityInfo#ACCESSIBILITY_ABILITY_TYPE_SPOKEN.
        stateType - Indicates the accessibility ability status. 1 indicates that the ability is enabled; 2 indicates that the ability is disabled; 3 indicates that the ability has been installed.
        Returns:
        Returns the list of accessibility abilities that meet the search criteria.
        See Also:
        AccessibilityAbilityInfo

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled​()
        Checks whether accessibility ability is enabled.
        Returns:
        Returns True if accessibility ability is enabled; returns False otherwise.

      • subscribeStateObserver

        public boolean subscribeStateObserver​(AccessibilityStateObserver observer,
                                      int eventType)
        Subscribes to the specified type of accessibility status change events.

        This method will receive a notification when the accessibility status has changed, for example, the accessibility ability is unavailable.

        Parameters:
        observer - Indicates the observer for listening to status events, which is specified by AccessibilityStateObserver.
        eventType - Indicates the status type, which is specified by AccessibilityStateEvent#EVENT_ACCESSIBILITY_STATE_CHANGED and AccessibilityStateEvent#EVENT_TOUCH_BROWSE_STATE_CHANGED.
        Returns:
        Returns True if the subscription is successful; returns False if an invalid parameter exists or the accessibility ability is disabled.
        See Also:
        AccessibilityStateObserver

      • unSubscribeStateObserver

        public boolean unSubscribeStateObserver​(AccessibilityStateObserver observer,
                                        int eventType)
        Unsubscribe the specified type of accessibility status change events.
        Parameters:
        observer - Indicates the registered accessibility status event observer.
        eventType - Indicates the status type, which is specified by AccessibilityStateEvent#EVENT_ACCESSIBILITY_STATE_CHANGED and AccessibilityStateEvent#EVENT_TOUCH_BROWSE_STATE_CHANGED.
        Returns:
        Returns True if the unsubscription is successful; returns False if an invalid parameter exists or the accessibility ability is disabled.
        Since:
        4
        See Also:
        AccessibilityStateObserver

      • unsubscribeStateObserver

        public boolean unsubscribeStateObserver​(AccessibilityStateObserver observer)
        Unsubscribe the accessibility status change events from the observer.
        Parameters:
        observer - Indicates the registered accessibility status event observer.
        Returns:
        Returns True if the unsubscription is successful; returns False if an invalid parameter exists or the accessibility ability is disabled.
        See Also:
        AccessibilityStateObserver

      • isAccessibilityCaptionEnabled

        public boolean isAccessibilityCaptionEnabled​()
        Checks whether the accessibility caption function is enabled.

                                int contentType)
        Obtains the suggested interval for switching the UI.
        Parameters:
        timeout - Indicates the interval at which the UI is changed.
        contentType - Indicates the type of the UI control.
        Returns:
        Returns the interval.
        Since:
